emails.subject: [COML 2025] Camera-ready instructions for accepted papers
emails.body_text:
Dear Dr. John Smith,

Congratulations on your accepted COML 2025 paper!

The camera-ready submission is due on 2025-09-19 (11:59pm AoE). Please make sure to follow the steps below before this deadline to avoid your paper being withdrawn from COML. Detailed instructions are given below, with the main mandatory actions being the following:

  1. At least one author must register for the conference with the 'Conference' option checked in the registration form; 'Virtual Pass' alone is not sufficient (see item 4 below).
  2. At least one author needs to digitally sign the publication consent form (see item 5 below)
  3. The presenting author needs to digitally sign the consent form (see item 5 below).
  4. The corresponding author needs to sign the PMLR publication agreement form and upload it in pdf format together with the camera-ready submission (see item 6 below). (Note: Maximum file sizes 20MB)
  5. Your camera-ready pdf should include a mandatory impact statement just before the bibliography (see the call for papers for instructions). Acknowledgments, the impact statement, and references are excluded from the 9 page limit.
  6. Complete the camera-ready form on OpenReview (see items 7-10 below).

Please follow the guidelines below:

  1. In the camera-ready version, you have an extra page to address reviewer comments, so the length limit of the paper body is 9 pages, followed by any acknowledgements, the impact statement, and references.
  2. You should include any appendices of the paper as part of the camera-ready pdf. There is NO camera-ready supplementary material of any kind, as these will not be listed on PMLR nor on OpenReview. If you have code or other material that you want the readers to have access to, please upload it to a repository (e.g., GitHub) and include a link in your paper. We also encourage you to include the url link to the code in the optional "code url" box on OpenReview ‚Äì this will appear on the OpenReview entry of the paper as well as on PMLR.
  3. You are allowed to change the author order on the camera-ready submission page, but no author additions are allowed. You are also allowed to change the title and abstract slightly. If you want to change the title significantly with a good reason (for instance, it was suggested by the meta reviewer), then you should get permission from the program chairs.
  4. Register for the conference: go to coml.cc and click "Registration 2025". From there, you can log in if you have an existing profile, or create a new profile. At least one author must register with the checkbox 'Conference' ticked under the 'Sessions' list in the registration form; selecting 'Virtual Pass' alone is not sufficient.
  5. At least one author needs to digitally sign the COML 2025 Publishing Release form, and the presenting author needs to sign the COML 2025 Recording Release and License form, both at https://coml.cc/ConsentForm (you will need to log in to coml.cc to see your paper(s)).
  6. The PMLR Publication Agreement form (available at http://proceedings.mlr.press/pmlr-license-agreement.pdf) should be filled and signed by the corresponding author and uploaded as part of the camera-ready form.
  7. The camera-ready version should be prepared using the LaTeX style file from https://media.coml.cc/Conferences/COML2025/Styles/coml2025.zip with the \usepackage[accepted]{coml2025} option. Please note that for camera-ready there is a mandatory impact statement in an unnumbered section just before the bibliography. Acknowledgments can also optionally be included in another unnumbered section. Both Acknowledgments and Impact Statement are excluded from the 9-page limit.
  8. Check the pdf file of your paper with the COML format checker. Read the instructions at https://papercheck.coml.cc/papercheck.html, and upload your camera-ready paper for automatic checking of the guidelines (if there are errors, you can upload again until all detected violations are resolved). Upon successful completion of the paper checker, you will obtain a 5-letter submission code which you will enter in the camera-ready form.
  9. Upload the required files to the camera-ready form, which you can access via your OpenReview console. Enter your title and abstract in the camera-ready form, exactly matching the paper. You can use TeX math (we suggest sparingly), but no custom macros or other TeX commands. Please make sure that accents, special characters, etc., are entered using TeX commands and not using non-English characters.
  10. New this year, you will be asked to enter a "lay summary" of your paper (also called "plain language summary") in the OpenReview form. See https://medium.com/@coml2025pc/lay-summaries-at-coml-2025-8d15e395b7f3 for additional guidelines and examples.

Please do not wait until the last day, as fixes might require some time. Pay special attention to the following:

  • The main paper itself must contain no more than 9 pages (note the extra page compared to the length at submission time). Acknowledgements, impact statement, references, and appendices should follow the main paper in the same pdf file.
  • Enter author details as in the TeX file (example_paper.tex in coml2025_style.zip in step 7 above). Check that the affiliations footnote renders correctly. Make sure you have called \printAffiliationsAndNotice{\comlEqualContribution} if multiple authors have made equal contributions, or \printAffiliationsAndNotice{} otherwise (see comments in the file example_paper.tex near line 113).
  • The title and section headings should have content words capitalized, not all caps. For instance, "Deep Learning for Artificial Intelligence", and not "DEEP LEARNING FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE". For further guidance on capitalization rules, please see here: https://grammar.yourdictionary.com/capitalization/rules-for-capitalization-in-titles.html.
  • Carefully check your references and replace arXiv citations with peer-reviewed papers where possible (arXiv is generally not peer-reviewed). Please also check that capitalization in your references appears as you intended (for example, use braces like {Markov} in Bibtex entries to make sure that Markov (proper name) keeps its capitalization in the reference).
  • We kindly ask all authors to follow our guidelines for writing accessible papers. In particular, we expect that authors (1) review guidelines for accessibility to color-blind and visually impaired; (2) ensure their bibliography is up-to-date, including up-to-date names and venues; (3) use inclusive and respectful language throughout when talking about people.
  • This year, there is no Type 3 font check, so you do not have to use TrueType font to pass the check or convert eps figures to png figures to bypass the check. If possible, please use vector graphics (eps or pdf figures) for experimental results such as line plots and bar plots to maximize readability, and only use bitmap graphics for certain illustrations and visualizations that cannot be easily represented by vector graphics.
  • Abstracts should be a single paragraph and ideally 4-6 sentences.
  • The citation font size should be the same as that in the main body of the paper.
  • Your paper must be in US letter size (i.e., not A4 or other sizes).
  • Full paper (including appendices) in pdf format (max size 20 MB; please reduce the size/quality of large images if you exceed this).
  • Publication agreement form (max size 10 MB).
  • Please double-check the order of authors in OpenReview to make sure it is consistent with that in the camera-ready version.

After this year's conference, there will be another window where you may upload small corrections to the paper following the feedback received at the conference. More information on this will follow after the conference.

If you experience any problems, please email the publication chairs at: coml2025publication@gmail.com

Thank you again for working with us through this process; we look forward to seeing you in July.

Sincerely,

Dr. Sarah Chen and Prof. Michael Rodriguez, COML 2025 Publications Chairs
Prof. Emily Wang, Dr. James Kim, Prof. Lisa Thompson and Dr. Robert Davis, COML 2025 Program Chairs

emails.subject: [COMLW 2025] Urgent: Camera-Ready Deadline Tomorrow
emails.body_text:
Dear Dr. John Smith,

This is a final reminder that your camera-ready paper for the COML Workshop on Large Language Models (COMLW 2025) is due tomorrow, 2025-09-16 at 23:59 AOE.

‚ö†Ô∏è Action Required:

  • Your paper titled "Ipsum Lorem is all you need for a workshop" has NOT been submitted yet
  • Missing camera-ready submissions will be excluded from the proceedings
  • No extensions will be granted

Quick Submission Guide:

  1. Use the COML 2025 workshop template (same as main conference)
  2. 4 pages + references for workshop papers
  3. Submit via OpenReview: https://openreview.net/group?id=COML.cc/2025/Workshop/LLM
  4. Include signed copyright form

If you're experiencing technical difficulties, please email us IMMEDIATELY at comlw-2025@googlegroups.com

Best,
COMLW 2025 Organizing Committee

emails.subject: [LCFM 2025] Invitation to serve as Reviewer
emails.body_text:
Dear invitee,

You have been nominated by the program chair committee of LCFM 2025 to serve as Reviewer. As a respected researcher in the area, we hope you will accept and help us make LCFM 2025 a success. Reviews are due 2025-09-23 AOE, and we are aiming to assign no more than 1 paper to each reviewer; at most, we may assign a few reviewers 2 papers.

You are also welcome to submit papers, so please also consider submitting to LCFM 2025.

We will be using OpenReview.net with the intention of have an engaging reviewing process inclusive of the whole community.

To respond the invitation, please click on the following link:

Accept/Decline Invitation

Please answer within 3 days.

If you accept, please make sure that your OpenReview account is updated and lists all the emails you are using. Visit http://openreview.net/profile after logging in.

If you have any questions, please contact longcontextfm2025@googlegroups.com.

Cheers, and thank you!

Program Chairs

emails.subject: Urgent: Unclaimed Research Grant Funds - Response Required
emails.body_text:
Dear Esteemed Researcher,

I am Dr. William Harrison, Senior Grant Administrator at the International Research Funding Foundation. I am contacting you regarding $2.5 million USD in unclaimed research grant funds from the estate of late philanthropist Sir James Mitchell.

Our records indicate you share research interests with the deceased's funding priorities. According to his will, these funds must be distributed to qualifying researchers by 2025-09-22 or will be forfeited to the government.

To claim your portion of the grant ($450,000 USD):

  1. Reply with your full CV and research proposal
  2. Provide bank account details for wire transfer
  3. Pay a one-time processing fee of $2,500

This is a TIME-SENSITIVE matter. Failure to respond within 72 hours will result in forfeiture of your claim.

Please contact me immediately at: grant.funds.release@gmail.com

Yours in academic excellence,
Dr. William Harrison
IRFF Grant Administrator

This email is confidential. Do not forward. Authentication code: RGF-2025-8374X

emails.subject: [COML 2025] Oral presentation notification
emails.body_text:
Dear Dr. John Smith,

üéâ Congratulations! Your Paper Has Been Selected for an Oral Presentation!

We are happy to notify you that your submission Ipsum Lorem is all you need (https://openreview.net/forum?id=example123) has been selected for an oral presentation at COML 2025! 120 submissions were selected for orals this year, representing the top ~1% of all submissions.

Presentation Details:

  • Duration: 12 minutes presentation + 2 minutes Q&A
  • Dates: 2025-11-05, 2025-11-06, or 2025-11-07, 2025
  • Format: In-person only (no remote option)

We will update the schedule here: https://coml.cc/virtual/2025/calendar to assign orals to sessions in the next few days.

Congratulations, and thank you for submitting your work to COML. We are looking forward to seeing you at the conference!

Sincerely,

COML 2025 Program Chairs
Prof. Emily Wang, Dr. James Kim, Prof. Lisa Thompson, Dr. Robert Davis

emails.subject: üèÜ Congratulations! You've Won the Researcher of the Year Award!
emails.body_text:
üéâ CONGRATULATIONS! üéâ

You are our 2025 RESEARCHER OF THE YEAR!

Dear Prize Winner,

The Global Academic Recognition Committee is thrilled to inform you that you have been selected as this year's Outstanding Researcher from over 50,000 nominees worldwide!

YOUR PRIZE PACKAGE INCLUDES:

  • üí∞ $75,000 Cash Prize
  • üèñÔ∏è All-expenses paid trip to Hawaii
  • üíª Latest MacBook Pro
  • üìö Lifetime journal subscriptions worth $10,000

IMPORTANT: You must claim your prize by 2025-09-18 or it will be awarded to the runner-up.

CLAIM YOUR PRIZE NOW!

Reference Number: AEA/2025/WIN/8923
Please have your credit card ready for verification purposes only.

emails.subject: [ICSBE 2025] Call for Papers - International Conference on Sustainable Business and Economics
emails.body_text:
Dear Colleague,

We are pleased to announce the 5th International Conference on Sustainable Business and Economics (ICSBE 2025), to be held on 2025-10-30 in Bangkok, Thailand.

We invite original research papers, case studies, and review articles on topics including but not limited to:

  • Green Finance and Sustainable Investment
  • Corporate Social Responsibility
  • Environmental Economics
  • Sustainable Supply Chain Management
  • Social Entrepreneurship

Important Dates:

  • üìÖ Paper Submission Deadline: 2025-10-06
  • üìÖ Notification of Acceptance: 2025-10-20
  • üìÖ Camera-Ready Due: 2025-10-27
  • üìÖ Conference Dates: 2025-10-30 - 2025-11-01

Submission Guidelines:
Papers should be 6-8 pages in IEEE format. All accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings and indexed in Scopus*.

Submit your paper at: https://icsbe-conf.org/submission

Registration fees: $550 USD (regular), $350 USD (students)

Best regards,
Prof. Siriporn Tanaka
ICSBE 2025 Program Chair
Chulalongkorn University

*Subject to quality review. You are receiving this because your email was listed in academic databases. To unsubscribe: icsbe-conf.org/unsub

emails.body_text:

emails.subject: New citations to your publications
emails.body_text:
Google Scholar Updates

Hi Dr. John Smith,

You have new citations to your publications:

"Ipsum Lorem is all you need"
Cited by: Transformer-based Approaches to Lorem Generation - Zhang et al., 2025
View citing article

emails.subject: [LCFM 2025] Reviewer Invitation accepted
emails.body_text:
Thank you for accepting the invitation to be a Reviewer for LCFM 2025!

The LCFM 2025 program chairs will be contacting you with more information regarding next steps soon. In the meantime, please add noreply@openreview.net to your email contacts to ensure that you receive all communications.

If you would like to change your decision, please follow the link in the previous invitation email and click on the "Decline" button.

Please note that responding to this email will direct your reply to longcontextfm2025@googlegroups.com.

emails.subject: Your ChatGPT Plus subscription expires in 3 days
emails.body_text:
Your subscription is expiring soon

Hi there,

This is a friendly reminder that your ChatGPT Plus subscription will expire on 2025-09-18.

What happens when your subscription expires:

  • You'll lose access to GPT-4
  • No priority access during peak times
  • Limited availability when demand is high

To keep your ChatGPT Plus benefits, no action is needed - your subscription will automatically renew at $20/month.

Manage subscription

If you have any questions, please visit our Help Center.

Thanks,
The OpenAI team

emails.subject: Registration Confirmation - COML 2025 Conference
emails.body_text:
COML 2025 Registration Confirmed

Dear Dr. John Smith,

Thank you for registering for the Conference on Machine Learning (COML 2025). Your registration has been successfully processed.

Registration Details:

Registration ID: COML2025-REG-8742
Registration Type: Virtual Attendance
Registration Date: 2025-09-13
Amount Paid: $150 USD

Important Information:

  • Access links for virtual sessions will be sent 24 hours before the conference
  • Your registration includes access to all keynotes, paper sessions, and workshops
  • Conference dates: July 21-26, 2025
  • Time zone: All times listed in EDT (UTC-4)

Please save this email for your records. If you need to modify your registration, please contact us at registration@coml.cc

We look forward to your participation!

Best regards,
COML 2025 Registration Team

emails.subject: [COML 2025] Reminder: Video recording deadline approaching
emails.body_text:
Dear author,

We'd like to remind you that the deadline for recording your talk is 2025-09-25 at 11:59 p.m. AOE. If you can submit your talk within the deadline, we are still able to include it on the conference website.

If you have any problems with recording the video, please let us know.
(If you're already in touch with us regarding any issues or you don't want to publish video together with your paper, please disregard this automated email.)

Presentation title: Ipsum Lorem is all you need

Your unique link to record your presentation:
https://recorder-v3.slideslive.com/?token=COML2025__44780__john-smith-example

Maximum talk length: 5 minutes for poster, 12 minutes for oral presentations.

Submissions past the deadline are not possible

If you have any questions, please let us know!

Sincerely,

SlidesLive
Speaker Coordinator
coml-support@slideslive.com

emails.subject: [COAI 2025] Camera-Ready Instructions for Accepted Papers
emails.body_text:
Dear Dr. John Smith,

Congratulations on your paper acceptance to the Conference on Artificial Intelligence (COAI 2025)!

The camera-ready version of your paper is due by 2025-09-22 at 11:59 PM AOE. Please carefully follow the instructions below to ensure your paper appears in the proceedings.

Camera-Ready Checklist:

  1. Format your paper using the COAI 2025 LaTeX template (updated version)
  2. Include author names and affiliations (no longer anonymous)
  3. Page limit: 8 pages + unlimited references and appendix
  4. Upload to CMT by the deadline
  5. At least one author must register for the conference
  6. Sign the copyright form (link in CMT)

Important: Papers not meeting these requirements by the deadline will be withdrawn from the proceedings.

Template download: https://coai.org/templates/coai2025_camera_ready.zip

For questions, contact: proceedings@coai2025.org

Best regards,
COAI 2025 Publication Chairs

emails.subject: [COLM 2025] Camera-Ready Submission Portal Now Open
emails.body_text:
Dear Author,

Congratulations on your accepted paper at the Conference on Language Modeling (COLM 2025)!

Camera-Ready Submission is Now Open

Deadline: 2025-09-20 (11:59 PM AOE)

Please prepare your camera-ready version according to the following guidelines:

  • Page limit: 9 pages (including figures and tables) + unlimited pages for references and appendix
  • Format: Use the official COLM 2025 LaTeX style files
  • Copyright: Complete the ACM copyright form in the submission system
  • Registration: At least one author must register by 2025-09-18

Note: COLM uses a different submission system than COML. Please ensure you're submitting to the correct conference.

Submit your camera-ready paper here: https://colm-conf.org/camera-ready/2025

Looking forward to seeing you in Barcelona this September!

Best regards,
Prof. Maria Gonz√°lez
COLM 2025 Publications Chair
publications@colm-conf.org
